intro: Quapoya acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed quapoya, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Quapoya acuminata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been the subject of botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
